availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Harrison H. Markham (Caldwell co. KY, overseer; Davidson cty, Tenn, stonemason)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, stonemason and overseer. Virginia native. Son of John W. Markham and Lucy Markham. Stonemason in Davidson County, Tennessee, in 1850. Household owned seven enslaved person in Davidson County in 1850. Overseer in Farmersville in 1860. Household owned fourteen enslaved persons in Farmersville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Davidson County, District 22, p. 374B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Tennessee, Davidson County, District 22, p. 609.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Farmersville, p. 123.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Farmersville, p. 210A-B.
